neighborhoods.name: Centro Storico
neighborhoods.character: The historic heart of Rome containing the highest concentration of ancient monuments and Renaissance architecture.

location.description: The central district of Rome encompassing many major historical sites.

history.overview: Centro Storico represents the ancient core of Rome with over 2,500 years of history.
history.significance: This district contains the highest concentration of historical monuments in the world.
notable_events: Establishment of Roman Forum (8th century BC)

practical_info.safety: Generally safe but watch for pickpockets in crowded tourist areas.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Early morning or evening to avoid crowds and heat.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with many pedestrian-only zones.

attractions.name: Pantheon
attractions.description: Nearly 2,000-year-old temple with the world's largest unreinforced concrete dome.
attractions.appeal: Marvel at ancient Roman engineering and perfect proportions.

attractions.name: Piazza Navona
attractions.description: Baroque square built over the ancient Stadium of Domitian.
attractions.appeal: Admire Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers in this lively public space.

attractions.name: Campo de' Fiori
attractions.description: Historic square with morning markets and evening nightlife.
attractions.appeal: Experience authentic Roman daily life from morning to night.

dining.name: Roscioli
dining.known_for: World-class carbonara and cacio e pepe

activities.name: Architectural Walking Tour
activities.description: Explore Renaissance and Baroque architectural masterpieces.

activities.name: Market Shopping
activities.description: Browse the morning market at Campo de' Fiori.

stay_here_if: You want to be within walking distance of major attractions.
You enjoy being in the heart of historical surroundings.
avoid_if: You're sensitive to crowds or noise.
You prefer modern amenities and spacious accommodations.
insider_tips: Visit major sites before 9am or after 5pm to avoid tour groups.
Explore the tiny side streets to find hidden churches and local eateries.

neighborhoods.name: Trastevere
neighborhoods.character: Charming medieval neighborhood with cobblestone streets, ivy-covered buildings, and authentic Roman atmosphere.

location.description: Located on the west bank of the Tiber river, south of Vatican City.
landmarks: Basilica di Santa Maria in Trastevere

history.overview: Originally a working-class district outside the ancient city walls, now a bohemian area that retains its medieval character.
history.significance: Historically home to a Jewish community and craftsmen; today represents authentic Roman life.
notable_events: Construction of Santa Maria in Trastevere (12th century)

practical_info.safety: Generally safe, though crowded at night during peak seasons.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Evening for dining atmosphere, morning for quiet exploration.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable, but cobblestones can be challenging.

attractions.name: Basilica di Santa Maria in Trastevere
attractions.description: One of Rome's oldest churches with stunning Byzantine mosaics.
attractions.appeal: Experience spiritual and artistic heritage in a less crowded setting.

attractions.name: Piazza di Santa Maria
attractions.description: The heart of Trastevere with cafes, street performers, and a Renaissance fountain.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for people-watching and experiencing local Roman life.

attractions.name: Villa Farnesina
attractions.description: Renaissance villa with frescoes by Raphael and other masters.
attractions.appeal: Enjoy masterpieces without the crowds of major museums.

dining.name: Da Enzo al 29
dining.known_for: Authentic Roman cuisine in tiny trattoria

activities.name: Evening Passeggiata
activities.description: Join locals for the traditional evening stroll.

activities.name: Photography Walk
activities.description: Capture ivy-covered buildings and charming alleyways.

stay_here_if: You want authentic Roman atmosphere with great dining options.
You enjoy nightlife and don't mind some evening noise.
avoid_if: You require quiet nights or modern luxury accommodations.
You have mobility issues (due to cobblestones).
insider_tips: Many restaurants require reservations, especially on weekends.
Explore the less touristy southern part of the neighborhood for local character.

neighborhoods.name: Monti
neighborhoods.character: Trendy bohemian neighborhood with a perfect blend of ancient ruins and hip modern venues.

location.description: Located between the Colosseum and Via Nazionale, just east of the Roman Forum.

history.overview: Rome's oldest residential district, once a slum in ancient times now transformed into a trendy neighborhood.
history.significance: Historically known as Suburra in ancient Rome; now celebrated for its artisanal shops and bohemian vibe.

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Afternoon for shopping, evening for dining atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent walkability with charming streets to explore.

attractions.name: Piazza della Madonna dei Monti
attractions.description: Neighborhood gathering spot with a Renaissance fountain.
attractions.appeal: Experience local Roman social life at its most authentic.

attractions.name: Mercato Monti
attractions.description: Weekend urban market featuring independent designers.
attractions.appeal: Find unique fashion and design items by local creators.

attractions.name: San Pietro in Vincoli
attractions.description: Church housing Michelangelo's Moses and St. Peter's chains.
attractions.appeal: See a masterpiece of Renaissance sculpture away from crowds.

dining.name: La Taverna dei Fori Imperiali
dining.known_for: Traditional Roman dishes with a creative twist

activities.name: Vintage Shopping
activities.description: Explore unique boutiques and vintage shops along Via del Boschetto.

activities.name: Wine Tasting
activities.description: Sample local wines at neighborhood enotecas.

stay_here_if: You want to be near major sights but in a trendier neighborhood.
You enjoy boutique shopping and artisanal experiences.
avoid_if: You require luxury chain hotels or spacious accommodations.
You have mobility issues (some streets have steep inclines).
insider_tips: Visit Mercato Monti on weekend mornings for the best selection.
Look for the hidden speakeasy-style bars that don't advertise.

neighborhoods.name: Vatican & Prati
neighborhoods.character: Elegant residential district adjacent to Vatican City with wide boulevards and refined atmosphere.

location.description: Located northwest of the Tiber river, surrounding Vatican City.

history.overview: Developed during the late 19th century after Rome became Italy's capital, with Borgo being much older.
history.significance: Houses Vatican City and provides elegant residential areas for professionals.
notable_events: Urban planning and development in the 1880s-1920s
Construction of the grand Via della Conciliazione (1936-1950)

practical_info.safety: Very safe, with high police presence near Vatican.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Early morning for Vatican sites, evening for local dining.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent with wide sidewalks and grid-pattern streets.

attractions.name: Vatican Museums
attractions.description: World-class collection including the Sistine Chapel and Raphael Rooms.
attractions.appeal: Experience some of the world's greatest art masterpieces.

attractions.name: St. Peter's Basilica
attractions.description: The largest church in the world and center of Catholicism.
attractions.appeal: Marvel at Renaissance architecture and Michelangelo's Pietà.

attractions.name: Castel Sant'Angelo
attractions.description: Ancient Roman mausoleum turned papal fortress with panoramic views.
attractions.appeal: Explore 2,000 years of Roman history in one building.

dining.name: Pizzarium
dining.known_for: Gourmet pizza al taglio by Gabriele Bonci

activities.name: Early Vatican Tour
activities.description: Visit the Vatican Museums before regular opening hours.

activities.name: Via Cola di Rienzo Shopping
activities.description: Browse upscale Italian and international brands.

stay_here_if: You plan to focus on Vatican sites.
You prefer a more refined, less chaotic Roman experience.
avoid_if: You want Rome's most vibrant nightlife.
You're seeking the most authentic local atmosphere.
insider_tips: Book Vatican Museum tickets weeks in advance or join early morning tours.
Local restaurants near the Vatican can be tourist traps—walk a few blocks into Prati for better options.

neighborhoods.name: Testaccio
neighborhoods.character: Authentic working-class neighborhood known for culinary traditions and unpretentious atmosphere.

location.description: Located south of Aventine Hill, along the Tiber River.

history.overview: Ancient Rome's river port and commercial hub, later home to the city's slaughterhouse and working-class families.
history.significance: The birthplace of many Roman culinary traditions due to workers using leftover animal parts from the slaughterhouse.
notable_events: Creation of Monte Testaccio from ancient Roman amphorae (1st-3rd centuries AD)

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Mornings for the market, evenings for dining.

attractions.name: Testaccio Market
attractions.description: Modern market hall with traditional food vendors and street food.
attractions.appeal: Experience authentic Roman food culture and local produce.

attractions.name: Monte Testaccio
attractions.description: Ancient Roman artificial hill made entirely of broken amphorae fragments.
attractions.appeal: Unique archaeological site that now houses nightclubs and restaurants at its base.

attractions.name: MACRO Testaccio
attractions.description: Contemporary art museum housed in the former slaughterhouse complex.
attractions.appeal: Experience cutting-edge art in a fascinating industrial setting.

dining.name: Mordi e Vai
dining.atmosphere: Market stall with constant lines of locals.

activities.name: Food Tour
activities.description: Guided tour of Testaccio's culinary highlights and market.

activities.name: Non-Catholic Cemetery Visit
activities.description: Visit the peaceful cemetery where Keats and Shelley are buried.

stay_here_if: You want an authentic Roman neighborhood experience.
Food is a primary focus of your trip.
avoid_if: You want to be within walking distance of major tourist sites.
You prefer upscale or luxury surroundings.
insider_tips: Visit the Testaccio Market in the morning and try lunch at Mordi e Vai.
Look for restaurants serving quinto quarto dishes—traditional Roman offal specialties born in this neighborhood.

neighborhoods.name: Aventino
neighborhoods.character: Elegant, quiet residential neighborhood with beautiful gardens and spectacular views.

location.description: Located on one of Rome's seven hills, southeast of Circus Maximus.

history.overview: One of Rome's original seven hills, historically associated with the plebeians in ancient Rome.
history.significance: Now one of Rome's most exclusive residential districts with religious significance.
notable_events: Site of the Temple of Diana in ancient Rome
Development of major monastic complexes in the Middle Ages

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for peaceful walks, sunset for views.

attractions.name: Knights of Malta Keyhole
attractions.description: Famous keyhole offering a perfectly framed view of St. Peter's dome.
attractions.appeal: One of Rome's most magical and Instagram-worthy photo opportunities.

attractions.name: Giardino degli Aranci
attractions.description: Orange garden with spectacular views of Rome's skyline.
attractions.appeal: Perfect spot for sunset viewing and romantic walks.

attractions.name: Basilica of Santa Sabina
attractions.description: 5th-century church with original wooden doors and simple elegance.
attractions.appeal: Experience early Christian architecture without crowds.

dining.name: Il Gabriello
dining.known_for: Refined Roman cuisine with excellent wine list

dining.name: L'Archeologia
dining.known_for: Classic dishes in a historic setting

activities.name: Sunset Photography
activities.description: Capture stunning views of Rome at golden hour.

activities.name: Rose Garden Visit
activities.description: Stroll through Rome's municipal rose garden (May-June).

stay_here_if: You prefer tranquility and upscale residential surroundings.
You don't mind being slightly removed from major nightlife.
avoid_if: You want vibrant nightlife or extensive dining options.
You have mobility issues (hill can be steep in places).
insider_tips: Visit the Knights of Malta Keyhole early in the morning to avoid lines.
The Rose Garden is only open during spring bloom (usually May-June).

neighborhoods.name: Pigneto
neighborhoods.character: Bohemian, multicultural neighborhood with street art, indie venues, and a vibrant nightlife.

location.description: Located east of Termini Station, outside the ancient walls.

history.overview: Former working-class district that has transformed into Rome's hipster hub since the early 2000s.
history.significance: Featured in Italian neorealist films, now a center for alternative culture and nightlife.

practical_info.safety: Generally safe but be cautious at night in some areas.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Evening for vibrant aperitivo and nightlife scene.
practical_info.walkability: Very walkable with pedestrianized central area.

attractions.name: Isola Pedonale del Pigneto
attractions.description: Car-free zone with bars, restaurants, and nightlife.
attractions.appeal: Heart of Rome's alternative scene with vibrant evening atmosphere.

attractions.name: Street Art Tour
attractions.description: Self-guided tour of murals by international and local artists.
attractions.appeal: See a different side of Rome's artistic expression.

attractions.name: Nuovo Cinema Aquila
attractions.description: Independent cinema showing arthouse and international films.
attractions.appeal: Cultural hub for film enthusiasts and local events.

dining.name: Necci dal 1924
dining.known_for: Historic café once frequented by Pasolini

activities.name: Bar Hopping
activities.description: Explore the diverse bars and music venues along the pedestrian strip.

activities.name: Vinyl Shopping
activities.description: Browse independent record stores with extensive collections.

stay_here_if: You want to experience Rome's alternative, non-touristy side.
Nightlife and creative culture are priorities.
avoid_if: You prefer traditional tourist experiences or luxury accommodations.
You're uncomfortable in slightly gritty urban environments.
insider_tips: Visit on Wednesday or Thursday evenings for the best balance of lively atmosphere without weekend crowds.
Look for aperitivo deals that include buffet food with drink purchases.

neighborhoods.name: Garbatella
neighborhoods.character: Charming, village-like district known for curved streets, garden courtyards, and traditional Roman spirit.

location.description: Located south of the city center, near Ostiense district.

history.overview: Planned garden city built in the 1920s to house workers, featuring unique architectural style.
history.significance: One of Rome's most distinctive planned neighborhoods with strong community identity.
notable_events: Preservation of community despite urban development

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Daytime for architecture, evening for local dining.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with interesting architectural details.

attractions.name: Garbatella Historic Center
attractions.description: Collection of 1920s garden city buildings with unique design features.
attractions.appeal: Explore one of Rome's most distinctive architectural experiments.

attractions.name: Teatro Palladium
attractions.description: Historic theater now run by Roma Tre University hosting performances and events.
attractions.appeal: Experience local cultural life in a historic venue.

attractions.name: Piazza Benedetto Brin
attractions.description: Central square with typical Garbatella architecture surrounding it.
attractions.appeal: Heart of the district with authentic local atmosphere.

dining.name: Ristoro degli Angeli
dining.known_for: Creative Italian cuisine with local ingredients

activities.name: Architectural Walking Tour
activities.description: Self-guided exploration of Garbatella's unique buildings and courtyards.

activities.name: Local Food Sampling
activities.description: Try traditional Roman dishes at authentic neighborhood spots.

stay_here_if: You want to experience authentic Roman life away from tourists.
avoid_if: You want to be within walking distance of major attractions.
You prefer areas with extensive nightlife options.
insider_tips: Look for the 'lotto' (numbered sections) of the original garden city development.
Visit during the annual Festa de Noantri in July for local celebrations.
